intro: Hippocratea holdeniana, commonly known as the Holden's hippocratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
